image.altText: Greyhound legs and lower torso while the animal is running.

props.synopsis: An inquiry that was launched after revelations by the ABC of dogs being abused has handed down 57 recommendations including the appointment of an independent inspector.

title.children: SA Premier gives greyhound racing industry two years to 'clean up its act', as independent inquiry hands down review

image.altText: A man in a red t-shirt and glasses looks directly at the camera while walking outside a court building

props.synopsis: A woman tells an Adelaide court she feared she would never see her family again after a man pretending to be a federal police officer accessed her hotel room and held at her gunpoint after asking to see her immigration papers.

title.children: Fake cop took 'pleasure in seeing how scared he made me', rape victim tells court

image.altText: Alison Maree Virgo and Amy June Collins

props.synopsis: Two directors of a former NDIS provider charged over the death of Adelaide woman Ann Marie Smith, who died while in full-time care, have been committed to stand trial.

title.children: Directors of former NDIS provider to stand trial over death of Ann Marie Smith

image.altText: David Warner points his bat

props.synopsis: Australia and Pakistan meet in Perth for the first Test match of the summer of cricket. Follow all the action in our live blog.

title.children: David Warner passes 150 as Australia takes control in first Test against Pakistan

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: GOT HIM! SMITH IS OUT! A MAIDEN TEST WICKET FOR SHAHZAD!

image.altText: A CFS firefighter stands next to a koala.

props.synopsis: Some landholders believe the heightened fears for this fire season could lead to people clearing too much native vegetation.

title.children: Adelaide Hills residents urged not to over-clear native vegetation in preparation for fire season

image.altText: The silhouette of a woman, sitting looking at a smartphone, in the airport lounge with a Qantas plane out the window

props.synopsis: Qantas submits to the federal government's aviation green paper that its recent performance has been "unacceptable".

title.children: Qantas says compensation scheme would hike airline prices

image.altText: Young boy in dark blue school jumper sitting on floor scratching caramel groodle dog under the chin, looking at each other

props.synopsis: A four-legged bundle of curly brown fur is putting smiles on the faces of pupils struggling with the deaths of a teacher and a student.

title.children: A groodle named Haze helps heal the collective heart of a tiny rural school beset by trauma and loss

image.altText: Lisa Wilkinson in a coral suit.

props.synopsis: Bruce Lehrmann is suing Lisa Wilkinson and Network Ten over a 2021 The Project interview in which Brittany Higgins alleged she was raped at Parliament House.

title.children: Lisa Wilkinson says she's not a 'cheap, tabloid journalist' as she defends airing Brittany Higgins interview

image.altText: aerial view of a fire burning towards a township

props.synopsis: Multiple fires burning in the NSW Hunter region have been downgraded to "watch and act" level as weather conditions ease.

title.children: Multiple out-of-control bushfires burning in 'extreme conditions' in NSW Hunter region

image.altText: A woman looks sad as she looks down the lense of a camera.

props.synopsis: Sally's family has been seeking shelter inside their local church in Gaza for weeks. She says the government's call for a ceasefire is "too little, too late".

title.children: Sally, whose family has sought shelter in Gaza church for weeks, deems government's ceasefire call too late

image.altText: a girl holding a mobile phone

props.synopsis: Some devices, including older mobile phones, will no longer be able to get service when Vodafone becomes the first of the three largest telcos to switch its 3G network off.

title.children: Australia's 3G network shutdown begins this Friday. Here's what you need to know

image.altText: Milwaukee Bucks NBA player Giannis Antetokounmpo is held back by the jersey as he runs up the hallway after a game.

props.synopsis: Indiana Pacers coach Ric Carlisle says the team's general manager has a bruised rib after copping an elbow in a physical confrontation with Milwaukee Bucks players over who got to keep the ball after the game.

title.children: Wild post-game scenes as Giannis Antetokounmpo scuffles with NBA opponents over who gets to keep game ball

image.altText: A female bartender smiles at a colleague cutting lemons as she shakes up a cocktail for waiting patrons

props.synopsis: Australia's unemployment rate increases to 3.9 per cent despite the creation of more than 60,000 jobs last month, as the participation rate surges to a fresh record high.

title.children: 'Genuine concerns' as cost-of-living squeeze drives record number of Australians into work

image.altText: a man walking with his dog

props.synopsis: Heavy rain has been falling for much of the night across parts on Far North Queensland after ex-Tropical Cyclone Jasper crossed the coast near Wujal Wujal.

title.children: Residents in the path of ex-Tropical Cyclone Jasper emerge to swollen rivers and flooded streets

image.altText: Outside of Maroochydore courthouse

props.synopsis: A Sunshine Coast court is told the accused is one of three girls who were "active and equal participants" in luring a child into a Tewantin house where she was subjected to a prolonged assault captured on camera.

title.children: Girl, 12, on torture charges a violent drug user likely to reoffend, judge hears

image.altText: Emma Richards wears a black tshirt and stands in front of a services australia building with a carpark.

props.synopsis: The incorrect attribution has upset the local Barngarla people, who say the wording looked like "a cut and paste job'" with little cultural consultation.

title.children: Government plaque naming wrong traditional owners 'quite upsetting', Barngarla people say

image.altText: A woman stands in a vineyard featuring a solar panel.

props.synopsis: Australian researchers are testing solar panels in a vineyard to see if they can help protect the fruit from extreme weather, but that is not the only potential benefit.

title.children: First, it was sheep under solar panels. Now, it's grapes

image.altText: Kathleen Folbigg wearing a purple top  wipes her eye

props.synopsis: Kathleen Folbigg, once labelled the nation's worst female serial killer, has the convictions for killing her four children overturned by the NSW Court of Criminal Appeal.

title.children: Kathleen Folbigg speaks out after convictions for killing children overturned

image.altText: A couple smiling holding a baby.

props.synopsis: A young couple has appeared in court charged over the death of Adelaide doctor Michael Yung after they allegedly stole from a pharmacy.

title.children: Adelaide couple allegedly stole medical items before being arrested over death of doctor Michael Yung, court told

image.altText: Two men stand in front of microphones in a park on a sunny day

props.synopsis: Authorities express frustration after a magistrate acquitted a 10-year-old boy, who tried to ram a police car in a stolen vehicle, because the child did not adequately grasp the severity of his offending.

title.children: ‘Basically it’s anarchy’: Frustration boils after child acquitted of attempting to ram police car

props.synopsis: An ABC investigation into the financial disclosures of sustainable or ethical-labelled super options finds extensive investment in shares of companies in the fossil fuel, gambling, alcohol and weapons manufacturing industries.

title.children: Over $1 billion of fossil fuel investment found in Australia's green super funds

image.altText: An image of Joe Biden speaking in front of a microphone. He is wearing a dark blue suit and a blue tie.

props.synopsis: The US House of Representatives votes to formally authorise its ongoing impeachment inquiry into President Joe Biden, as Republicans unite behind the effort despite a lack of evidence of wrongdoing by the Democrat.

title.children: US President Joe Biden impeachment inquiry authorised by House Republicans despite lack of evidence

image.altText: A collection of credit cards.

props.synopsis: Experts say it's easier than you think for cybercriminals to guess your credit card details. And it's costing customers and small businesses.

title.children: What's a BIN attack and how are cybercriminals guessing your credit card number?

image.altText: A woman standing next to a bed in a colourful bedroom with lots of coloured clothes hanging from the wall.

props.synopsis: There are currently only about 100 specialist disability accommodation properties available outside of Sydney, leaving many people like Petrina Williams no choice but to live in a rental where she cannot access basic amenities.

title.children: Petrina can't access the shower in her rental property but it's the only home she can find

image.altText: Mono Go Head 1

props.synopsis: Monopoly Go has earnt more than $1 billion in revenue since release but a recent promotion referencing a Dreamtime story has been slammed for a lack of consultation with First Nations people.

title.children: 'Did you even stop to consult anyone Aboriginal?': US game studio faces questions over use of Indigenous culture

image.altText: Lemur babies 2

props.synopsis: The black-and-white ruffed lemur triplets will undergo DNA testing after zookeepers at Altina Wildlife Park in southern NSW were caught "very unaware" by their arrival.

title.children: 'Surprise': Three lemurs born out of the blue as search for mystery father begins

image.altText: women and men protest the overturning of Roe V Wade

props.synopsis: When the US Supreme Court overturned Roe v Wade last year, it did not remove the issue from the courts. This week, they're playing out in five different states.

title.children: A year after Roe V Wade was overturned, states are facing their own abortion cases across the US

image.altText: Anne Rasmussen speaks from her position amongst seated delegates.

props.synopsis: After COP28's central document was approved, Samoa's lead delegate delivered a critical assessment of the Dubai climate summit agreement's flaws — and pointed out the Pacific Islands delegates were not even in the room when the deal was done.

title.children: 'We are a little confused': Pacific representatives 'not in the room' as COP28 deal approved

image.altText: Two people drag calves by their limbs along an abattoir floor.

props.synopsis: Primary Industries Minister Jo Palmer announces a task force and says kill floor footage at a Tasmanian abattoir showing animals still conscious and alert is "unacceptable".

title.children: Farmers demand immediate CCTV in Tasmanian abattoirs after 'horrific' footage

image.altText: Graffiti across walls of Hosier Lane in Melbourne, people seen to the distance.

props.synopsis: A man turns himself into police following an alleged attempted abduction in Melbourne's CBD last month.

title.children: Man arrested after alleged attempted abduction of 14yo in Melbourne CBD

image.altText: A composite image of a a man, a woman with blonde hair and a woman with black hair.

props.synopsis: Australia's Margot Robbie is in the running for a Critics Choice award as Barbie leads the film section with 18 nominations.

title.children: These are the nominees for the best films of the year, according to critics
